page.title: 04Homes
page.content:
Most of the houses in Ticknall were built in the Nineteenth Century when Ticknall was a thriving community, with Limework and brickyards. Many of them were originally just one storey, made of stone, with a second storey of brick added later. They are mainly owned by Calke Estate. Recently many of the cottages have been modernized and have modern conveniences which include central heating.
Since Mr. Henry Harpur Crewe inherited the Estate he has had to pay Â£8,000,000 in Death Duties. This has meant that some of the older properties have had to be sold. One farm house was sold for Â£90,000.
In 1970 the Church commissioners sold the Vicarage and Garden.
